metadata.title: CVE-2024-36014 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/arm/malidp: fix a possible null pointer dereferenceIn malidp_mw_connector_reset, new memory is allocated with kzalloc, butno check is performed. In order to prevent null pointer dereferencing,ensure that mw_state is checked before calling__drm_atomic_helper_connector_reset.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-36014` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
